testcase.name: ERC721 1. Initialize 1.1. Should assign states successfully
testcase.classname: 1.1. Should assign states successfully

testcase.name: ERC721 2. Mint 2.1. Should be fail when address is zero address
testcase.classname: 2.1. Should be fail when address is zero address

testcase.name: ERC721 2. Mint 2.2. Should be fail when amount is equal 0
testcase.classname: 2.2. Should be fail when amount is equal 0

testcase.name: ERC721 2. Mint 2.3. Should be fail when price is equal 0
testcase.classname: 2.3. Should be fail when price is equal 0

testcase.name: ERC721 2. Mint 2.4. Should be fail when user pay native token and msg.value is not equal amount
testcase.classname: 2.4. Should be fail when user pay native token and msg.value is not equal amount

testcase.name: ERC721 2. Mint 2.5. Should be fail when user pay native token less than price of token
testcase.classname: 2.5. Should be fail when user pay native token less than price of token

testcase.name: ERC721 2. Mint 2.6. Should be fail when user pay other token less than price of token
testcase.classname: 2.6. Should be fail when user pay other token less than price of token

testcase.name: ERC721 2. Mint 2.7. Should be fail when transaction is not signed by verifier
testcase.classname: 2.7. Should be fail when transaction is not signed by verifier

testcase.name: ERC721 2. Mint 2.8. Should mint successfully when user pay native token
testcase.classname: 2.8. Should mint successfully when user pay native token

testcase.name: ERC721 2. Mint 2.9. Should mint successfully when user pay other token
testcase.classname: 2.9. Should mint successfully when user pay other token

testcase.name: ERC721 3. Set Admin 3.1. Should be fail when caller is not the owner
testcase.classname: 3.1. Should be fail when caller is not the owner

testcase.name: ERC721 3. Set Admin 3.2. Should be fail when setting zero address
testcase.classname: 3.2. Should be fail when setting zero address

testcase.name: ERC721 3. Set Admin 3.3. Should set successfully
testcase.classname: 3.3. Should set successfully

testcase.name: ERC721 4. Set Verifier 4.1. Should be fail when caller is not the owner
testcase.classname: 4.1. Should be fail when caller is not the owner

testcase.name: ERC721 4. Set Verifier 4.2. Should be fail when setting zero address
testcase.classname: 4.2. Should be fail when setting zero address

testcase.name: ERC721 4. Set Verifier 4.3. Should set successfully
testcase.classname: 4.3. Should set successfully

testcase.name: ERC721 5. Set Expiration 5.1. Should be fail when caller is not the admin
testcase.classname: 5.1. Should be fail when caller is not the admin

testcase.name: ERC721 5. Set Expiration 5.2. Should be fail when setting 0
testcase.classname: 5.2. Should be fail when setting 0

testcase.name: ERC721 5. Set Expiration 5.3. Should set successfully
testcase.classname: 5.3. Should set successfully

testcase.name: ERC721 6. Set Token URI 6.1. Should be fail when token ID is nonexistent
testcase.classname: 6.1. Should be fail when token ID is nonexistent

testcase.name: ERC721 6. Set Token URI 6.2. Should be fail when transaction is not signed by verifier
testcase.classname: 6.2. Should be fail when transaction is not signed by verifier

testcase.name: ERC721 6. Set Token URI 6.3. Should be fail when signature data is invalid
testcase.classname: 6.3. Should be fail when signature data is invalid

testcase.name: ERC721 6. Set Token URI 6.4. Should set successfully
testcase.classname: 6.4. Should set successfully

testcase.name: ERC721 7. Set Token Status 7.1. Should be fail when set a token is nonexistent
testcase.classname: 7.1. Should be fail when set a token is nonexistent

testcase.name: ERC721 7. Set Token Status 7.2. Should be fail when set value is equal status of current token
testcase.classname: 7.2. Should be fail when set value is equal status of current token

testcase.name: ERC721 7. Set Token Status 7.3. Should be fail when transaction is not signed by verifier
testcase.classname: 7.3. Should be fail when transaction is not signed by verifier

testcase.name: ERC721 7. Set Token Status 7.4. Should be fail when signature is invalid
testcase.classname: 7.4. Should be fail when signature is invalid

testcase.name: ERC721 7. Set Token Status 7.5. Should set successfully
testcase.classname: 7.5. Should set successfully

testcase.name: ERC721 8. Get token URI 8.1. Should be fail when get a token is nonexistent
testcase.classname: 8.1. Should be fail when get a token is nonexistent

testcase.name: ERC721 8. Get token URI 8.2. Should return exact token URI
testcase.classname: 8.2. Should return exact token URI

testcase.name: ERC721 8. Get token URI 8.3. Should retrieve exacty token URI after setting token URI
testcase.classname: 8.3. Should retrieve exacty token URI after setting token URI

testcase.name: ERC721 9. Withdraw 9.1. Should be fail when caller is not owner
testcase.classname: 9.1. Should be fail when caller is not owner

testcase.name: ERC721 9. Withdraw 9.2. Should be fail when recipient address is zero addess
testcase.classname: 9.2. Should be fail when recipient address is zero addess

testcase.name: ERC721 9. Withdraw 9.3. Should be fail when amount is equal 0
testcase.classname: 9.3. Should be fail when amount is equal 0

testcase.name: ERC721 9. Withdraw 9.4. Should be fail when owner withdraw amount greater than withdrawable amount
testcase.classname: 9.4. Should be fail when owner withdraw amount greater than withdrawable amount

testcase.name: ERC721 9. Withdraw 9.5. Should be successfull when owner withdraw native token
testcase.classname: 9.5. Should be successfull when owner withdraw native token

testcase.name: ERC721 9. Withdraw 9.6. Should withdraw successfully when owner withdraw other token
testcase.classname: 9.6. Should withdraw successfully when owner withdraw other token

testcase.name: ERC721 10. Claim 10.1. Should be fail when recipient address is zero address
testcase.classname: 10.1. Should be fail when recipient address is zero address

testcase.name: ERC721 10. Claim 10.2. Should be fail when amount of money want to claim is greater than current balance
testcase.classname: 10.2. Should be fail when amount of money want to claim is greater than current balance

testcase.name: ERC721 10. Claim 10.3. Should be successful when owner withdraws amount of all owned native token
testcase.classname: 10.3. Should be successful when owner withdraws amount of all owned native token

testcase.name: ERC721 10. Claim 10.4. Should be successful when owner withdraws a part of owned cash test token
testcase.classname: 10.4. Should be successful when owner withdraws a part of owned cash test token

testcase.name: ERC721 10. Claim 10.5. Should be successful when user claims amount of all owned cash test token
testcase.classname: 10.5. Should be successful when user claims amount of all owned cash test token

testcase.name: ERC721 10. Claim 10.6. Should be successful when user claims a part of owned native token
testcase.classname: 10.6. Should be successful when user claims a part of owned native token

testcase.name: ERC721 11. Transfer 11.1. Should be fail when sender transfer token to self
testcase.classname: 11.1. Should be fail when sender transfer token to self

testcase.name: ERC721 11. Transfer 11.2. Should be fail when recipient address is zero address
testcase.classname: 11.2. Should be fail when recipient address is zero address

testcase.name: ERC721 11. Transfer 11.3. Should be fail when token is nonexistent
testcase.classname: 11.3. Should be fail when token is nonexistent

testcase.name: ERC721 11. Transfer 11.4. Should be fail when token is deactive
testcase.classname: 11.4. Should be fail when token is deactive

testcase.name: ERC721 11. Transfer 11.5. Should be fail when token is not owned by sender
testcase.classname: 11.5. Should be fail when token is not owned by sender

testcase.name: ERC721 11. Transfer 11.6. Should transfer successfully
testcase.classname: 11.6. Should transfer successfully
